title: Divergent loop (each application of the formatter causes new changes)
body:
There's a reproducible divergent loop on this file: [apache-geode/geode-core/src/main/java/org/apache/geode/internal/cache/LocalRegion.java](https://github.com/nedtwigg/incubator-geode/blob/5d0fb4d8b450cb908e71ca730d29ece309b34344/geode-core/src/main/java/org/apache/geode/internal/cache/LocalRegion.java) Each time the formatter is called, it adds two newlines above the `
` tag on [line 684](https://github.com/nedtwigg/incubator-geode/blob/5d0fb4d8b450cb908e71ca730d29ece309b34344/geode-core/src/main/java/org/apache/geode/internal/cache/LocalRegion.java#L684-L685), and two newlines above the closing `` tag on [line 695](https://github.com/nedtwigg/incubator-geode/blob/5d0fb4d8b450cb908e71ca730d29ece309b34344/geode-core/src/main/java/org/apache/geode/internal/cache/LocalRegion.java#L693-L694).

Perhaps related to #84? If you call the formatter 10 times, then you end up with 20 newlines in each of these places.

We found this bug using the ["padded cell" functionality in Spotless](https://github.com/diffplug/spotless/blob/master/PADDEDCELL.md), which checks that `Formatter(Formatter(input)) == Formatter(input)`, and handles misbehaving rules by resolving cycles, ignoring divergence, etc.  Whenever a violation is found, it generates a set of files for reproducing the issue which demonstrate the cycle or divergence.

There's an [open PR on this project](https://github.com/google/google-java-format/pull/83) to point gradle users to this Spotless plugin.  People who use it will likely be able to find other helpful testcases, while insulating them from the bug in the short-term.

If you'd like to reproduce this for yourself, clone https://github.com/nedtwigg/incubator-geode, and checkout tag `Bug37`.  Run `gradlew spotlessCheck` and it'll tell you which files are divergent and the testcases will be in `build/spotless-diagnose-java`.
